name: Black Bean and Corn Salsa
description: This wildly versatile Black Bean and Corn Salsa will have you dreaming up all sorts of ways to use it:  tacos, salads, even wraps!  I think it tastes best when the lime flavor is at the forefront so feel free to add another squeeze!
recipeIngredient: juice of 2 limes (plus more to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Drain and rinse the corn and black beans, adding them to a mixing bowl.  Note that we're only using 1/2 can of black beans in this version.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain and rinse the corn and black beans, adding them to a mixing bowl.  Note that we're only using 1/2 can of black beans in this version.

recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop the 3 tomatoes, 1/2 red onion, 1 jalapeno, and 12-15 cilantro sprigs; adding them to the mixing bowl.  I usually twist off and discard the thicker, bottom portion of the cilantro stems but keep the upper stems.
recipeInstructions.name: Finely chop the 3 tomatoes, 1/2 red onion, 1 jalapeno, and 12-15 cilantro sprigs; adding them to the mixing bowl.  I usually twist off and discard the thicker, bottom portion of the cilantro stems but keep the upper stems.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the juice of 2 limes, 1 tablespoon adobo sauce, and 1 teaspoon salt.  Combine well and take a final taste for seasoning, adding more salt or lime if necessary.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the juice of 2 limes, 1 tablespoon adobo sauce, and 1 teaspoon salt.  Combine well and take a final taste for seasoning, adding more salt or lime if necessary.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with a generous sprinkling of Cotija cheese.  Serve immediately or store in an airtight container in the fridge.
